author: James R. Hagerty
title: Don Carter, High-School Dropout, Brought NBA Basketball to Dallas
text:
After dropping out of high school in the late 1940s, Don Carter had modest ambitions. He loved drag racing and figured his job at a gas station would bring in enough money to keep his car running.
Service in the U.S. Air Force changed him. He embraced his motherâ€™s fervent Christian faith and joined her in running a company she founded, Home Interiors & Gifts Inc., to market candles, picture frames and household knickknacks.
